channel.title: Is this a good build?
channel.description:
A while ago I posted a topic for a budget gaming computer which I never got. I decided to continue saving my money until I had enough for a good rig. I need to spend under $1200, this is what I came up with:
HDD: [url=http://www.newegg.ca/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16822148433]Seagate Barracuda 1TB (7200 RPM, SATA, 3.0Gb/s)[/url] GFX Card: [url=http://www.newegg.ca/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814150359]XFX Radeon HD 4890 1GB[/url] PSU: [url=http://www.newegg.ca/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16817139006]CORSAIR 750W ATX12V / EPS12V[/url] Memory: [url=http://www.newegg.ca/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16820231166]G.SKILL 4GB (2 x 2GB) 240-Pin DDR2 SDRAM DDR2 1066 (PC2 8500) (x2)[/url] Motherboard: [url=http://www.newegg.ca/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16813128358]GIGABYTE LGA 775 Intel P45 ATX Intel Motherboard[/url] CPU: [url=http://www.newegg.ca/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16819115041]Intel Core 2 Quad Q9550 Yorkfield (95W, 12MB Cache, 2.833Ghz)[/url] VGA Cooler: [url=http://www.newegg.ca/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16835118117]ZALMAN VF700-CU 2 Ball[/url]
Total w/shipping: $1,173.94 As for a chassis, I have an older one that will work.
edit: changed HDD

item.title: Is this a good build?
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

blah bah7:

If you can afford it you should really look into i7 processors, they will be at least half the price of that computer though.

Double you mean? To build an i7, it’ll be at least $1500 and I can’t afford that right now.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a good build?
item.dc:creator: @blah_bah7 blah bah7
item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

If you can afford it you should really look into i7 processors, they will be at least half the price of that computer though.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a good build?
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

I’ve read a few about this card, and everyone seems pretty happy with it. It’s perfect for my budget, I have a well air-cooled case, so I figured the VGA cooler would help out.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a good build?
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

You don’t need the VGA cooler, that one mounts directly to the board. If you want an external one, it won’t do much good either. It’ll probably just trap the hot air around the card.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a good build?
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

Horrible.

Get this:
PC Power and Cooling PSU
EVGA nVidia GFX card
Corsair RAM
EVGA Mobo
Intel 8400 proc (Quad core is useless for gaming, only a few fps advantage)
Fuck that “VGA cooler”
Get an aftermarket CPU cooler if your going to OC
Buy a good case like the Antec 900 or 1200

kthxbai.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a good build?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

In my experience with PSU’s, there is no such thing as overkill

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a good build?
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

Good build, the PSU is a bit overkill though, a corsair 550w would handle all that.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a good build?
item.dc:creator: @vbcoderx vbcoderx
item.description:
@vbcoderx wrote:

la­wl:

ive been using western digital for several years in several computers and have never had any problems.

same here.

I also stand with mopar about not being a big fan of ATI cards. Also, ATI likes to release closed source drivers for linux if any. Nvidia drivers for linux are a lot easier to find and are more abundant… I currently have that ram in my comp and I love it! That build also looks similar to the build im getting ready to build. but double the cost with worse components

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a good build?
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

ive been using western digital for several years in several computers and have never had any problems.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a good build?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

I doubt any form of RAID is worth it for him. Just get a single 1tb drive, and an external firewire drive for backups.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a good build?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:13, topic:290095”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=383474.msg2878831#msg2878831 date=1248207230]

I thought mirrored RAID was slower than just a single disk? (having to write everything twice…).

RAID 5 is mirrored and striping, thus you receive low read and high write speeds.

Would this be a better harddrive?
http://www.newegg.ca/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16822148433

Yes, if my large-disk idea is a myth. I’ve had excellent performance out of barracudas, though.
[/quote]
And sure, mirrored and striping RAID is the way to go, but then you need 8 250GB hard drives to have 1TB, and how many computers have that many connections?[/quote]
5 drives. 1000 = 250(5-1). Perhaps a over the norm, but manageable. Besides, 1TB is quite a bit of space.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a good build?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:12, topic:290095”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=383474.msg2878807#msg2878807 date=1248206186]
I thought mirrored RAID was slower than just a single disk? (having to write everything twice…).
[/quote]
RAID 5 is mirrored and striping, thus you receive low read and high write speeds.

Would this be a better harddrive?
http://www.newegg.ca/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16822148433

Yes, if my large-disk idea is a myth. I’ve had excellent performance out of barracudas, though.[/quote]

The large-disk thing is most certainly a myth. Besides, large is hard to define, my first computer had a ‘large’ hard drive, 502MB. And sure, mirrored and striping RAID is the way to go, but then you need 8 250GB hard drives to have 1TB, and how many computers have that many connections?

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a good build?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Unhandled:

I thought mirrored RAID was slower than just a single disk? (having to write everything twice…).

RAID 5 is mirrored and striping, thus you receive low read and high write speeds.

[quote=“Holic, post:11, topic:290095”]Would this be a better harddrive?
http://www.newegg.ca/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16822148433[/quote]
Yes, if my large-disk idea is a myth. I’ve had excellent performance out of barracudas, though.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a good build?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Mopman:

they didnt brick because they were large, they bricked because seagate released a bad firmware update

Okay, but I thought larger drives were less stable. Or is that a myth? Still, RAIDing is better than a stand-alone drive for speed and keeping data safe (if mirrored).

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a good build?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

they didnt brick because they were large, they bricked because seagate released a bad firmware update

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a good build?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:290095”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=383474.msg2878770#msg2878770 date=1248203831]

They are pretty much the only hard drive I’ve ever seen go bad, I’d recommend seagate or maxtor.

i guess you missed all of the bricked 500gb seagate barracudas then

(all manufacturers fuck up sometimes, seagate just do it with style)

Buying large drives (over 250GB) is dumb. One would be better off RAIDing; plus, on-board SATA RAID controllers are quite common on medium to high-end motherboards.
[/quote]

I wouldn’t say drives over a certain size are dumb, and RAIDing say 4 250gb drives so they look like a single 1TB drive is a horrible idea, because you just increased the likelihood that your data will be destroyed by 4.[/quote]
A proper RAID array (let’s say RAID5+) contains a mirror, am I correct? How does that increase the likelihood of data loss?

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a good build?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:5, topic:290095”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=383474.msg2878764#msg2878764 date=1248203610]

They are pretty much the only hard drive I’ve ever seen go bad, I’d recommend seagate or maxtor.

i guess you missed all of the bricked 500gb seagate barracudas then

(all manufacturers fuck up sometimes, seagate just do it with style)
[/quote]
Buying large drives (over 250GB) is dumb. One would be better off RAIDing; plus, on-board SATA RAID controllers are quite common on medium to high-end motherboards.[/quote]

I wouldn’t say drives over a certain size are dumb, and RAIDing say 4 250gb drives so they look like a single 1TB drive is a horrible idea, because you just increased the likelihood that your data will be destroyed by 4.

Read full topic

i guess you missed all of the bricked 500gb seagate barracudas then

(all manufacturers fuck up sometimes, seagate just do it with style)[/quote]
Buying large drives (over 250GB) is dumb. One would be better off RAIDing; plus, on-board SATA RAID controllers are quite common on medium to high-end motherboards.

item.title: Is this a good build?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Looks good. Buy a Seagate HDD, though.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a good build?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’m not a big fan of ATI cards, but to each thier own. But please, don’t get a WD hard drive, I just got one in the mail for my mother’s computer that came DOA, and my brother gave me his that is less than a year old and is bad. They are pretty much the only hard drive I’ve ever seen go bad, I’d recommend seagate or maxtor.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a good build?
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

A while ago I posted a topic for a budget gaming computer which I never got. I decided to continue saving my money until I had enough for a good rig.
I need to spend under $1200, this is what I came up with:

HDD: Seagate Barracuda 1TB (7200 RPM, SATA, 3.0Gb/s)
GFX Card: XFX Radeon HD 4890 1GB
PSU: CORSAIR 750W ATX12V / EPS12V
Memory: G.SKILL 4GB (2 x 2GB) 240-Pin DDR2 SDRAM DDR2 1066 (PC2 8500) (x2)
Motherboard: GIGABYTE LGA 775 Intel P45 ATX Intel Motherboard
CPU: Intel Core 2 Quad Q9550 Yorkfield (95W, 12MB Cache, 2.833Ghz)
VGA Cooler: ZALMAN VF700-CU 2 Ball

Total w/shipping: $1,173.94
As for a chassis, I have an older one that will work.

edit: changed HDD

Read full topic
